intro: Quercus turbinella subsp. ajoensis, commonly known as the Ajoensis Turkey Oak, is a subspecies of the Turkey Oak native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. The tree produces small, pale yellow to reddish-brown acorns that are encased in a cupule. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The subspecies is notable for its distinctive foliage and its role in supporting local wildlife.
